item.title: Exploit details for max severity Cisco IOS XE flaw now public
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Technical details about a maximum-severity Cisco IOS XE WLC arbitrary file upload flaw tracked as CVE-2025-20188 have been made publicly available, bringing us closer to a working exploit. [...]

item.title: Hackers are exploiting critical flaw in vBulletin forum software
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two critical vulnerabilities affecting the open-source forum software vBulletin have been discovered, with one confirmed to be actively exploited in the wild. [...]

item.title: Microsoft now testing Notepad text formatting in Windows 11
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft announced today that the Windows 11 Notepad application is getting a text formatting feature supporting Markdown-style input. [...]

item.title: Police takes down AVCheck site used by cybercriminals to scan malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An international law enforcement operation has taken down AVCheck, a service used by cybercriminals to test whether their malware is detected by commercial antivirus software before deploying it in the wild. [...]

item.title: Germany doxxes Conti ransomware and TrickBot ring leader
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Federal Criminal Police Office of Germany (Bundeskriminalamt or BKA) claims that Stern, the leader of the Trickbot and Conti cybercrime gangs, is a 36-year-old Russian named Vitaly Nikolaevich Kovalev. [...]

item.title: Getting Exposure Management Right: Insights from 500 CISOs
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Pentera
item.description: Pentesting isn't just about finding flaws — it's about knowing which ones matter. Pentera's 2025 State of Pentesting report uncovers which assets attackers target most, where security teams are making progress, and which exposures still fly under the radar. Focus on reducing breach impact, not just breach count. [...]

item.title: Mozilla releases Firefox 139.0.1 update to fix artifacts on Nvidia GPUs
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Mozilla has rolled out an emergency Firefox 139.0.1 update after the Tuesday release caused graphical artifacts on PCs with NVIDIA GPUs. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Authenticator now warns to export passwords before July cutoff
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Microsoft Authenticator app is now issuing notifications warning that the password autofill feature is being deprecated in July, suggesting users move to Microsoft Edge instead. [...]

item.title: ConnectWise breached in cyberattack linked to nation-state hackers
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: IT management software firm ConnectWise says a suspected state-sponsored cyberattack breached its environment and impacted a limited number of ScreenConnect customers. [...]

item.title: Threat actors abuse Google Apps Script in evasive phishing attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors are abusing the trusted Google platform 'Google Apps Script' to host phishing pages, making them appear legitimate and eliminating the risk of them getting flagged by security tools. [...]

item.title: Apple Safari exposes users to fullscreen browser-in-the-middle attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A weakness in Apple's Safari web browser allows threat actors to leverage the fullscreen browser-in-the-middle (BitM) technique to steal account credentials from unsuspecting users. [...]

item.title: US sanctions firm linked to cyber scams behind $200 million in losses
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned Funnull Technology, a Philippines-based company that supports hundreds of thousands of malicious websites behind cyber scams linked to over $200 million in losses for Americans. [...]
